remarks: If ` D ` is a metric space such that all the balls of some fixed size are relatively compact, then ` D ` is complete.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)
statement:
relcmpcmet.1 $e |- J = ( MetOpen ` D ) $.
relcmpcmet.2 $e |- ( ph -> D e. ( Met ` X ) ) $.
relcmpcmet.3 $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
relcmpcmet.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. X ) -> ( J |`t ( ( cls ` J ) ` ( x ( ball ` D ) R ) ) ) e. Comp ) $.
relcmpcmet $p |- ( ph -> D e. ( CMet ` X ) ) $.
$d D x $.
$d J x $.
$d R x $.
$d X x $.
$d ph x $.
